The arising of the attainment of what is to be eliminated by cultivation when advancing from a mind that is not to be eliminated means:
when abiding in the path of seeing, at the time of the three kinds of knowledge of the truth of suffering, the truth of the cause of suffering, and the truth of the cessation of suffering,

the attainment of the mundane knowledge cultivated at the end of the three contemplations arises simultaneously with that mind. Using the uncontaminated path, one becomes free from the defilements of the desire realm up to the sphere of nothingness.
If the uncontaminated [path] is used as preparation,
at the time of all the paths of preparation, uninterrupted [path], and liberation,
and becoming free from the defilements of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
if the uncontaminated [path] is used as preparation,
at the time of the path of preparation,
the attainment of the mundane path cultivated in the future arises simultaneously with that mind.
When one is free from the defilements of the desire realm up to the third meditative absorption,
at the time of the ninth liberated path,
that mind also arises together with the acquisition of the various types of mind that are fruits of the transcendent path.
When the diamond-like concentration and the knowledge of the destruction [of the defilements] arise,
that mind arises together with the acquisition of the mundane good [mind] at that time,
and also perhaps with the acquisition of the various types of mind that are fruits of the transcendent path.
When one of unshakable nature perfects the faculties and becomes one who has attained through views,
if the uncontaminated [path] is the applied practice,
at the time of the path of application,

and at the time of the liberated path,
that mind arises together with the acquisition of the mundane path that will be cultivated in the future,
and also perhaps with the acquisition of the various types of mind that are fruits of the transcendent path.
When a temporarily liberated arhat perfects the faculties and becomes one of unshakable nature,
if the uncontaminated [path] is the applied practice,
at the time of the path of application,
that mind arises together with the mundane path that will be cultivated in the future,
and also perhaps with the acquisition of the various types of mind that are fruits of the transcendent path.

That mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the mundane good mind obtained at that time,
and with the acquisition of the various good minds and the fruits of the path.
When one generates the pure supernormal knowledge of others' minds,
at the first and last moments of the various meditations,
when one generates the pure mindfulness of the body based on the concentration of the form realm,
and when the pure unobstructed understanding increases,
that mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the future mundane path,
and with the acquisition of the various good minds and the fruits of the path.
When one generates the pure liberation,
and when one generates the pure mindfulness of the body based on the concentration of the formless realm,
and when the pure unobstructed understanding increases,
excluding the various good minds and the fruits of the path.
That mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the rest as before,
and with the uninterrupted mind.
As long as the characteristics of birth, aging, duration, and non-eternality of those dharmas arise,
it means when one is born in the desire or form realms and abides in the pure concentrations of the formless realm,
the growth and increase of the faculties and the great elements.
That mind arises simultaneously with the four characteristics of its acquisition.
If dharmas are concomitant with a mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation,
are those dharmas formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by cultivation?
Answer: Dharmas that are concomitant with a mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation,
those dharmas are either formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by cultivation,
or formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by seeing,
or formless dharmas that are not to be abandoned.
What are formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by cultivation?
Answer: Dharmas that are associated with that mind.
Those that are concomitant with that mind are formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by cultivation. The meaning is explained as before.
What are formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by seeing?
Answer: Like a mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation, if one regresses or advances,
formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by seeing arise.
This is like the explanation above of formless dharmas that are to be abandoned by seeing arising concomitant with a mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation.
What are formless dharmas that are not to be abandoned?
Answer: Like a mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation,
if one regresses or advances,
formless dharmas that are not to be abandoned arise.
A mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation regresses and formless dharmas that are not to be abandoned arise.
This refers to when an arhat regresses from a superior faculty and abides in an inferior faculty.
When the mind to be eliminated by cultivation arises simultaneously with the acquisition of dharmas not eliminated by the inferior faculties,
it is the same when a learner regresses from the superior lineage and abides in the inferior lineage.
When an arhat arouses the fetters of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
up to the eighth category of fetters of the first meditation, at the time of regression,
his mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the fruit of non-returner and the path of superior fruit.
If one arouses the superior superior fetters of the first meditation and regresses,
if one is still able to protect and practice diligently,
his mind also arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the above-mentioned undestroyed [dharmas].
If there is one who is unable to protect and practice diligently,
his mind only arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the fruit of non-returner.
When non-returners arouse the two categories of inferior inferior and inferior middle fetters of the desire realm and regress,
their mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the fruit of once-returner and the path of superior fruit.
If one arouses the superior inferior fetters and regresses,
if one is still able to protect and practice diligently,
his mind also arises simultaneously with the acquisition of the above-mentioned undestroyed [dharmas].
If one is unable to protect and enhance one's practice,
then one's mind only arises together with the attainment of the fruit of once-returning.
If one regresses due to the arising of the five categories of bonds from the middle to the upper middle,
then one's mind arises together with the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry and the path to the superior fruit.
If one regresses due to the arising of the highest category of bonds,
but is still able to protect and enhance one's practice,
then one's mind also arises together with the attainment that is not severed as before.
If one is unable to protect and enhance one's practice,
then one's mind only arises together with the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry.
As for the arising of the attainment that is not severed when the mind to be eliminated by cultivation advances,
it refers to when noble ones, using the worldly path, are free from the defilements of the desire realm,
up to the sphere of nothingness.
If the worldly [path] is used as preparation,
at the time of all the paths of preparation, uninterrupted [path], and liberation,
and when free from the defilements of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
if the worldly [path] is used as preparation,
at the time of the path of preparation,
That mind arises simultaneously with the obtainment of all dharmas that are cultivated in the future and are not severed.
Faith-liberation, when perfecting the faculties, becomes view-attainer.
And time-liberated arhats, when perfecting the faculties, become immovable.
If worldly [minds] are used as preparations,
at the time of the path of preparation,
that mind arises simultaneously with the obtainment of all dharmas that are cultivated in the future and are not severed.
If noble ones induce the various supernormal powers, in the various paths of preparation,
five uninterrupted paths,
two paths of liberation,
and worldly supernormal knowledge of others' minds,
at the time of the path of liberation,
when the mind in between is cultivated in the meditative absorption of mixed practice,
when noble ones give rise to the four immeasurables,
worldly liberations,
eight spheres of mastery,
ten universal bases,
when giving rise to unobstructed understanding and worldly unobstructed understanding increases,
when giving rise to the desire for non-conflict, the knowledge of specific destinies, the culminating absorption,
emptiness of emptiness, wishlessness of wishlessness, signlessness of signlessness, and their increase,
when noble ones give rise to the contemplation of impurity,
mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,
When one is mindful of the conventional truth,
when one gives rise to the thought of entering the attainment of cessation and the subtle mind arises,
that mind arises simultaneously with the acquisition of all dharmas that are not abandoned in the future.
All dharmas that are not abandoned and arise in the formless realm,
are those dharmas not abandoned and simultaneous with the mind?
Answer: All dharmas that are not abandoned and arise in the formless realm,
those dharmas may be not abandoned and simultaneous with the mind,
or they may be simultaneous with the mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation.
How are they not abandoned and simultaneous with the mind?
Answer: All dharmas that are associated with that mind,
and those that exist simultaneously with that mind,
the meaning of not abandoned formless dharmas is explained as above.
How are they simultaneous with the mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation?
Answer: As when the mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation either regresses or advances,
the acquisition of dharmas that are not abandoned arises.
This is like the explanation of not abandoned formless dharmas arising simultaneously with the mind that is to be abandoned by cultivation.
If a dharma arises simultaneously with the mind that is not abandoned,
are those dharmas not abandoned and formless?
Answer: All dharmas that arise simultaneously with the mind that is not abandoned,
those dharmas may be not abandoned and formless,
Or it is the formless [constituents] that are to be eliminated by cultivation.
What are the formless [constituents] that are not to be eliminated?
The answer is: those dharmas that are associated with that mind,
and those that are simultaneous with that mind.
The meaning of the formless [constituents] that are not to be eliminated is explained as above.
What are the formless [constituents] that are to be eliminated by cultivation?
The answer is: when the attainment of dharmas to be eliminated by the path of cultivation arises in the mind that is not to be eliminated, and
when the faculties and the great elements that are to be eliminated by cultivation increase and grow in the mind that is not to be eliminated,
the attainment, birth, aging, duration, and impermanence of those dharmas
are explained as being simultaneous with the mind that is not to be eliminated, just as the formless [constituents] that are to be eliminated by cultivation arise.

Do all first dhyÄnas have five factors?
The answer is: The undefiled ones have five.
The defiled ones do not have five.
